pygcu.auth.oauth module

Implementation for RestAPI OAuth2.0 protocol

class pygcu.auth.oauth.OAuthApi(client_id: str, client_secret: str, grant_type: str = 'client_credentials', timeout: int = 600)[source]

Bases: object

RestAPI implementation of OAuth2.0.

This class is designed to be subclassed around a specific data source. Manages two sessions one for authentication and token refreshing and the other is used as the base URL for api calls. Built-in token refresh and auto timeout.

Example Usage:

from pygcu.auth import OAuthApi

class ExampleDataSourceUsing(OAuthApi):
    def setup(self):
        self.authorize_url = "https://example.com/token"
        self.endpoint_url = "https://example.com/api"

    def get_all_the_things(self):
        resp = self._main_session.get(
            "https://example.com/api/get_all_the_things",
            headers={"Authorization": f"Bearer {self._api_token}"}
        )

        if resp.status_code != 200:
            print("invalid response")
        return resp.json()

client_id = "xxxxxxx"
client_secret = "xxxxxxx"

with ExampleDataSourceUsing(client_id, client_secret) as src:

    # use built-in methods
    resp = src.smart_call(
        func=src._main_session.get,
        url="https://example/api/get_all_the_things",
        headers={"Authorization": f"Bearer {src._api_token}}
    )

    ## or.. create your own
    resp = src.get_all_the_things()
Parameters:

  • client_id – (str) - client id or username

  • client_secret – (str) - client secret or password

  • grant_type – (str) - grant_type, defaults to ‘client_credentials’

  • timeout – (int) - time, in seconds, to wait for response timeout, defaults to 600 seconds (10 min)
